com.sujit.yahoo.mailer.SendMail

Class MailerApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sujit.yahoo.mailer.SendMail.MailerApp

  • public class MailerApp
extends java.lang.Object
    Standard Mailer class to send HTML enabled mails with file attachments. This can be used in any application to send mails. This class uses the Yahoo! free send mail SMTP host by default, so please use discretion to send huge amount of mails. As they say, since it's free, better to use it judiciously to keep it that way :) Otherwise, if you have access to any other SMTP server then please use that instead of the free one. Thanks!

    Please note that this class has been written to use un-authorized SMTP servers, which does not need a password. This class WON'T work with SMTP servers which need password for authentication.
    Author:
    sujitroy

    • Method Detail

      • sendPlainTextMail

        public void sendPlainTextMail(java.lang.String to,
                     java.lang.String cc,
                     java.lang.String from,
                     java.lang.String subject,
                     java.lang.String body,
                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> attachementFilePathList)
        Method to send a simple plain text mail with file attachments. The file paths needs to be passed as a list.
        Parameters:
        to - To email address (can be comma separated)
        cc - Cc email address (can be comma separated)
        from - Sender email address
        subject - Subject of the mail
        body - Body of the mail in PlainText
        attachementFilePathList - List of file paths on local system

      • sendHTMLMail

        public void sendHTMLMail(java.lang.String to,
                java.lang.String cc,
                java.lang.String from,
                java.lang.String subject,
                java.lang.String bodyHTML,
                java.util.List<java.lang.String> attachementFilePathList)
        Method to send a HTML formatted mail with file attachments. You can use free form HTML text as body of the mail. The file paths needs to be passed as a list.
        Parameters:
        to - To email address (can be comma separated)
        cc - Cc email address (can be comma separated)
        from - Sender email address
        subject - Subject of the mail
        bodyHTML - HTML text for mail body
        attachementFilePathList - List of file paths on local system
